required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Study to Assess the Efficacy and Safety of Dysport® in the Treatment of Chronic Plantar Fasciitis
clinical_study.official_title: Double-blind, Placebo-controlled, Randomised, Multicentre Study on the Efficacy and Safety of a Single Injection of Botulinum Toxin A (200 Units Dysport®) in the Treatment of Chronic Plantar Fasciitis

brief_summary.textblock: This study will investigate the hypothesis that the analgesic effect of a single injection of Dysport (200 MU) induces a significant reduction of symptoms in chronic cases of plantar fasciitis.

primary_outcome.measure: Responders Rate at Week 6 (Pain While Moving)
primary_outcome.description: The responder rate was defined as the percentage of patients whose pain score while moving during the last 48 hours, measured by means of a 10 cm Visual Analogue Scale (VAS, 0 = no pain, 10 = maximum pain) decreased by at least 50% at Week 6 as compared to baseline. Pain at movement is the cardinal symptom of plantar fasciitis and the 10 cm VAS is a reference method for the assessment of pain intensity.

secondary_outcome.measure: Changes From Baseline in Gerbershagen's Score at Week 18
secondary_outcome.description: The Gerbershagen scale gives a global score ranging between I and III, with lower scores reflecting less impact of pain in terms of temporal, spatial aspects, drug taking behaviour and utilization of the health care system. The changes in Gerbershagen's global scores from baseline to Week 18 are reported as percentage of patients for each of the specified categories.

secondary_outcome.measure: Changes From Baseline in Maximum Pain (Pain While Moving) at Each Visit
secondary_outcome.description: Assessments of the pain intensity while moving (maximum pain during the previous 48 hours) were performed by means of a 10 cm VAS (0 = no pain, 10 = maximum pain) at each visit. The changes from baseline, expressed as Pain Intensity Difference (PID) values at each indicated timepoint are reported.

secondary_outcome.measure: Assessment of Sum of Pain Intensity Difference (SPID) for Maximum Pain for Overall Study
secondary_outcome.description: Assessments of the pain intensity while moving (maximum pain during the previous 48 hours) were performed by means of a 10 cm VAS (0 = no pain, 10 = maximum pain) at each visit. The PID values at each timepoint were determined by comparison to baseline, followed by calculation of the area under the curve (AUC) of PID as a function of time (i.e. SPID). The least square (LS) means of SPID, adjusted for the baseline value of pain while moving are reported.

secondary_outcome.measure: Changes From Baseline in Continuous Pain (Pain At Rest) at Each Visit
secondary_outcome.description: Assessments of the pain intensity while at rest (continuous pain during the previous 48 hours) were performed by means of a 10 cm VAS (0 = no pain, 10 = maximum pain) at each visit. The changes from baseline, expressed as PID values at each indicated timepoint are reported.

secondary_outcome.measure: Assessment of SPID for Continuous Pain for Overall Study
secondary_outcome.description: Assessments of the pain intensity while at rest (continuous pain during the previous 48 hours) were performed by means of a 10 cm VAS (0 = no pain, 10 = maximum pain) at each visit. The PID values at each timepoint were determined by comparison to baseline, followed by calculation of the AUC of PID as a function of time (i.e. SPID). The LS means for SPID, adjusted for the baseline value of pain at rest are reported.

secondary_outcome.measure: Changes From Baseline in Pain Threshold at Each Visit
secondary_outcome.description: The maximum pain felt in the medial back foot was measured using an algometer. The pain threshold corresponded to the maximum pressure at which pain was still tolerated. Changes from baseline, expressed as pain threshold differences at each indicated timepoint are reported.

secondary_outcome.measure: Assessment of Sum of Pain Threshold Differences (by Measurement of AUC) for Overall Study
secondary_outcome.description: Assessments of the pain threshold using an algometer (which was the pressure corresponding to the maximum tolerated pain) were performed at each visit. Pain threshold differences at each timepoint were determined by comparison to baseline, followed by calculation of the AUC of the pain threshold difference as a function of time. The LS means of AUC, adjusted for the baseline value of pain threshold are reported.

secondary_outcome.measure: Changes From Baseline in Pressure Threshold (With Algometer) at Each Visit
secondary_outcome.description: Pressure pain in the medial back foot was measured using an algometer. Pressure threshold corresponded to the minimum pressure causing pain. The changes from baseline, expressed as pressure threshold differences at each indicated timepoint are reported.

secondary_outcome.measure: Assessment of Sum of Pressure Threshold Differences (by Measurement of AUC) for Overall Study
secondary_outcome.description: Assessments of the pressure threshold using an algometer (which corresponded to the minimum pressure causing pain) were performed at each visit. Pressure threshold differences at each timepoint were determined by comparison to baseline, followed by calculation of the AUC of the pressure threshold difference as a function of time. The LS means of AUC, adjusted for the baseline value of pressure threshold are reported.

secondary_outcome.measure: Assessment of Dorsal Extension / Plantar Flexion Range of Motion (ROM) of the Affected Foot At Week 18
secondary_outcome.description: Dorsal extension and plantar flexion of the affected foot were assessed at baseline and at Week 18. A ROM of approximately 70 degrees is considered to be normal. The LS means, adjusted for the baseline value are reported.

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of Patients Without Pain and/or With a Pain Reduction Based on Global Assessment of Pain by Investigator at Each Visit
secondary_outcome.description: A global assessment of the patient's current condition relative to baseline was performed by the Investigator at each visit using 5 level scale: significantly better, slightly better, unchanged, slightly worse, significantly worse. The number of patients for each variable at each indicated timepoint are reported.

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of Patients Without Pain and/or With a Pain Reduction Based on Global Assessment of Pain by Patient at Each Visit
secondary_outcome.description: A global assessment of the patient's current condition relative to baseline was performed by the patient at each visit using a 5 level scale: significantly better, slightly better, unchanged, slightly worse, significantly worse. The number of patients for each variable at each indicated timepoint are reported.

intervention.description: Botulinum type A toxin (Dysport®): 200 Units injected at the root of the plantar fascia
0.9% sodium chloride: 2 ml injected at the root of the plantar fascia

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Chronic plantar fasciitis (duration of disorder at least 4 months)
- At least 4 points on the visual analogue scale (0-10) for the most severe pain within the last 48 hours
- At least 2 previous unsuccessful conservative therapies
- Age 18 and older
Exclusion Criteria:
- Rheumatoid diseases (M. Bechterew, chronic polyarthritis, psoriasis-arthritis, para /post-infectious arthritis etc.)
- Previous surgery in the affected area of the foot
- Pre-treatment with Botulinum toxin A (only de novo patients)
- Prohibited concomitant treatment: local injections during the study and 2 weeks prior to start of study

facility.name: University Hospital Charite, Campus Virchow, Musculoskeletal Centre, Orthopedic Clinic
Klinik für Orthopädie und Rheumatologie, Universitätsklinikum Gießen und Marburg GmbH

results_reference.citation: Peterlein CD, Funk JF, Hölscher A, Schuh A, Placzek R. Is botulinum toxin A effective for the treatment of plantar fasciitis? Clin J Pain. 2012 Jul;28(6):527-33. doi: 10.1097/AJP.0b013e31823ae65a.

participant_flow.recruitment_details: The study was a double-blind, placebo-controlled, randomized, prospective study where patients were recruited to 5 study centres in Germany. Patients were enrolled to the study from 08 July 2005 (first patent enrolled) until 23 April 2009 (last patient completed).
participant_flow.pre_assignment_details: 40 patients were enrolled. Patients were assigned to treatment if they met all inclusion and none of the exclusion criteria. All patients enrolled were randomized and received study treatment.

group.title: Dysport ® 200 U
group.description: Patients received one injection of 200 units (U) Dysport® at Week 0 (Day 0). The study treatment was injected into the origin of the plantar fascia in accordance with the clinical findings on palpation, the injection being distributed in four portions in a fan-shaped manner using a single 0.50 x 40mm needle. Follow-up examinations to assess the efficacy and safety of the treatment were performed at Weeks 2, 6, 10, 14 and 18.

group.title: Placebo
group.description: Patients received one injection of placebo (physiological sodium chloride solution, 2ml) at Week 0 (Day 0). The study treatment was injected into the origin of the plantar fascia in accordance with the clinical findings on palpation, the injection being distributed in four portions in a fan-shaped manner using a single 0.50 x 40mm needle. Follow-up examinations to assess the efficacy and safety of the treatment were performed at Weeks 2, 6, 10, 14 and 18.

baseline.population: Baseline characteristics are presented for all patients randomized in the study.

group.title: Dysport ® 200 U
group.description: Patients received one injection of 200 units (U) Dysport® at Week 0 (Day 0). The study treatment was injected into the origin of the plantar fascia in accordance with the clinical findings on palpation, the injection being distributed in four portions in a fan-shaped manner using a single 0.50 x 40mm needle. Follow-up examinations to assess the efficacy and safety of the treatment were performed at Weeks 2, 6, 10, 14 and 18.

group.title: Placebo
group.description: Patients received one injection of placebo (physiological sodium chloride solution, 2ml) at Week 0 (Day 0). The study treatment was injected into the origin of the plantar fascia in accordance with the clinical findings on palpation, the injection being distributed in four portions in a fan-shaped manner using a single 0.50 x 40mm needle. Follow-up examinations to assess the efficacy and safety of the treatment were performed at Weeks 2, 6, 10, 14 and 18.

outcome.title: Responders Rate at Week 6 (Pain While Moving)
outcome.description: The responder rate was defined as the percentage of patients whose pain score while moving during the last 48 hours, measured by means of a 10 cm Visual Analogue Scale (VAS, 0 = no pain, 10 = maximum pain) decreased by at least 50% at Week 6 as compared to baseline. Pain at movement is the cardinal symptom of plantar fasciitis and the 10 cm VAS is a reference method for the assessment of pain intensity.
outcome.population: The Intention-To-Treat (ITT) analysis set was defined as the set of randomized patients who received study treatment and for whom values of the efficacy parameters were available at baseline and at least once at a later timepoint. Missing values were replaced using the last observation carried forward (LOCF) method.

group.title: Dysport ® 200 U
group.description: Patients received one injection of 200 units (U) Dysport® at Week 0 (Day 0). The study treatment was injected into the origin of the plantar fascia in accordance with the clinical findings on palpation, the injection being distributed in four portions in a fan-shaped manner using a single 0.50 x 40mm needle. Follow-up examinations to assess the efficacy and safety of the treatment were performed at Weeks 2, 6, 10, 14 and 18.

group.title: Placebo
group.description: Patients received one injection of placebo (physiological sodium chloride solution, 2ml) at Week 0 (Day 0). The study treatment was injected into the origin of the plantar fascia in accordance with the clinical findings on palpation, the injection being distributed in four portions in a fan-shaped manner using a single 0.50 x 40mm needle. Follow-up examinations to assess the efficacy and safety of the treatment were performed at Weeks 2, 6, 10, 14 and 18.

measure.title: Responders Rate at Week 6 (Pain While Moving)
measure.description: The responder rate was defined as the percentage of patients whose pain score while moving during the last 48 hours, measured by means of a 10 cm Visual Analogue Scale (VAS, 0 = no pain, 10 = maximum pain) decreased by at least 50% at Week 6 as compared to baseline. Pain at movement is the cardinal symptom of plantar fasciitis and the 10 cm VAS is a reference method for the assessment of pain intensity.
measure.population: The Intention-To-Treat (ITT) analysis set was defined as the set of randomized patients who received study treatment and for whom values of the efficacy parameters were available at baseline and at least once at a later timepoint. Missing values were replaced using the last observation carried forward (LOCF) method.

analysis.groups_desc: The responders rate at Week 6 was compared between treatment groups by a two-sided Fisher exact test.

outcome.title: Changes From Baseline in Gerbershagen’s Score at Week 18
outcome.description: The Gerbershagen scale gives a global score ranging between I and III, with lower scores reflecting less impact of pain in terms of temporal, spatial aspects, drug taking behaviour and utilization of the health care system. The changes in Gerbershagen’s global scores from baseline to Week 18 are reported as percentage of patients for each of the specified categories.
outcome.population: The ITT analysis set was defined as the set of randomized patients who received study treatment and for whom values of the efficacy parameters were available at baseline and at least one later timepoint. This variable could only be analyzed for 30 patients (15 from each group) for whom the score could be determined both at baseline and at Week 18.

group.title: Dysport ® 200 U
group.description: Patients received one injection of 200 units (U) Dysport® at Week 0 (Day 0). The study treatment was injected into the origin of the plantar fascia in accordance with the clinical findings on palpation, the injection being distributed in four portions in a fan-shaped manner using a single 0.50 x 40mm needle. Follow-up examinations to assess the efficacy and safety of the treatment were performed at Weeks 2, 6, 10, 14 and 18.

group.title: Placebo
group.description: Patients received one injection of placebo (physiological sodium chloride solution, 2ml) at Week 0 (Day 0). The study treatment was injected into the origin of the plantar fascia in accordance with the clinical findings on palpation, the injection being distributed in four portions in a fan-shaped manner using a single 0.50 x 40mm needle. Follow-up examinations to assess the efficacy and safety of the treatment were performed at Weeks 2, 6, 10, 14 and 18.

measure.title: Changes From Baseline in Gerbershagen’s Score at Week 18
measure.description: The Gerbershagen scale gives a global score ranging between I and III, with lower scores reflecting less impact of pain in terms of temporal, spatial aspects, drug taking behaviour and utilization of the health care system. The changes in Gerbershagen’s global scores from baseline to Week 18 are reported as percentage of patients for each of the specified categories.
measure.population: The ITT analysis set was defined as the set of randomized patients who received study treatment and for whom values of the efficacy parameters were available at baseline and at least one later timepoint. This variable could only be analyzed for 30 patients (15 from each group) for whom the score could be determined both at baseline and at Week 18.

class.title: Baseline score = I; Week 18 score = I
Baseline score = II; Week 18 score = I
Baseline score = II; Week 18 score = II
Baseline score = II; Week 18 score = III
Baseline score = III; Week 18 score = I
Baseline score = III; Week 18 score = II
Baseline score = III; Week 18 score = III

analysis.groups_desc: Gerbershagen’s Global scores were compared at Week 18 using a Cochran-Mantel-Haenszel analysis of variance statistic with adjustment to the baseline score.

outcome.title: Changes From Baseline in Maximum Pain (Pain While Moving) at Each Visit
outcome.description: Assessments of the pain intensity while moving (maximum pain during the previous 48 hours) were performed by means of a 10 cm VAS (0 = no pain, 10 = maximum pain) at each visit. The changes from baseline, expressed as Pain Intensity Difference (PID) values at each indicated timepoint are reported.
outcome.population: The ITT analysis set was defined as the set of randomized patients who received study treatment and for whom values of the efficacy parameters were available at baseline and at least one later timepoint. Missing values were replaced using the LOCF method.

The PID values at each timepoint were determined by comparison to baseline, followed by calculation of the area under the curve (AUC) of PID as a function of time (i.e. SPID). measure.title: Assessment of Sum of Pain Intensity Difference (SPID) for Maximum Pain for Overall Study
measure.description: Assessments of the pain intensity while moving (maximum pain during the previous 48 hours) were performed by means of a 10 cm VAS (0 = no pain, 10 = maximum pain) at each visit. The PID values at each timepoint were determined by comparison to baseline, followed by calculation of the area under the curve (AUC) of PID as a function of time (i.e. SPID). analysis.groups_desc: SPID was compared between the two treatment groups using a fixed effect analysis of covariance (ANCOVA) taking into account the SPID value as dependent variable, the baseline pain intensity as co-variable, and the treatment group as explicative variable.

Follow-up examinations to assess the efficacy and safety of the treatment were performed at Weeks 2, 6, 10, 14 and 18.

group.title: Placebo
group.description: Patients received one injection of placebo (physiological sodium chloride solution, 2ml) at Week 0 (Day 0). The study treatment was injected into the origin of the plantar fascia in accordance with the clinical findings on palpation, the injection being distributed in four portions in a fan-shaped manner using a single 0.50 x 40mm needle. Follow-up examinations to assess the efficacy and safety of the treatment were performed at Weeks 2, 6, 10, 14 and 18.

measure.title: Assessment of Sum of Pressure Threshold Differences (by Measurement of AUC) for Overall Study
measure.description: Assessments of the pressure threshold using an algometer (which corresponded to the minimum pressure causing pain) were performed at each visit. Pressure threshold differences at each timepoint were determined by comparison to baseline, followed by calculation of the AUC of the pressure threshold difference as a function of time. The LS means of AUC, adjusted for the baseline value of pressure threshold are reported.
measure.population: The ITT analysis set was defined as the set of randomized patients who received study treatment and for whom values of the efficacy parameters were available at baseline and at least one later timepoint. Missing values were replaced using the LOCF method.

analysis.groups_desc: The sum of pressure threshold difference (i.e. SPID expressed as AUC) was compared between the two treatment groups using a fixed effect ANCOVA taking into account the SPID AUC value as dependent variable, the baseline pain intensity as co-variable, and the treatment group as explicative variable.

outcome.title: Assessment of Dorsal Extension / Plantar Flexion Range of Motion (ROM) of the Affected Foot At Week 18
outcome.description: Dorsal extension and plantar flexion of the affected foot were assessed at baseline and at Week 18. A ROM of approximately 70 degrees is considered to be normal. The LS means, adjusted for the baseline value are reported.
outcome.population: The ITT analysis set was defined as the set of randomized patients who received study treatment and for whom values of the efficacy parameters were available at baseline and at least one later timepoint. This variable was only analyzed for 34 patients (18 for Dysport® and 16 for Placebo) for whom ROM was determined at both baseline and Week 18.

group.title: Dysport ® 200 U
group.description: Patients received one injection of 200 units (U) Dysport® at Week 0 (Day 0). The study treatment was injected into the origin of the plantar fascia in accordance with the clinical findings on palpation, the injection being distributed in four portions in a fan-shaped manner using a single 0.50 x 40mm needle. Follow-up examinations to assess the efficacy and safety of the treatment were performed at Weeks 2, 6, 10, 14 and 18.

group.title: Placebo
group.description: Patients received one injection of placebo (physiological sodium chloride solution, 2ml) at Week 0 (Day 0). The study treatment was injected into the origin of the plantar fascia in accordance with the clinical findings on palpation, the injection being distributed in four portions in a fan-shaped manner using a single 0.50 x 40mm needle. Follow-up examinations to assess the efficacy and safety of the treatment were performed at Weeks 2, 6, 10, 14 and 18.

measure.title: Assessment of Dorsal Extension / Plantar Flexion Range of Motion (ROM) of the Affected Foot At Week 18
measure.description: Dorsal extension and plantar flexion of the affected foot were assessed at baseline and at Week 18. A ROM of approximately 70 degrees is considered to be normal. The LS means, adjusted for the baseline value are reported.
measure.population: The ITT analysis set was defined as the set of randomized patients who received study treatment and for whom values of the efficacy parameters were available at baseline and at least one later timepoint. This variable was only analyzed for 34 patients (18 for Dysport® and 16 for Placebo) for whom ROM was determined at both baseline and Week 18.

analysis.p_value_desc: The difference (most affected side – control side) in ROM for the dorsal extension was analyzed using a fixed effect ANCOVA, using Week 18 results as the dependent variable and baseline value as covariate.

outcome.title: Number of Patients Without Pain and/or With a Pain Reduction Based on Global Assessment of Pain by Investigator at Each Visit
outcome.description: A global assessment of the patient's current condition relative to baseline was performed by the Investigator at each visit using 5 level scale: significantly better, slightly better, unchanged, slightly worse, significantly worse. The number of patients for each variable at each indicated timepoint are reported.
outcome.population: The ITT analysis set was defined as the set of randomized patients who received study treatment and for whom values of the efficacy parameters were available at baseline and at least one later timepoint.

group.title: Dysport ® 200 U
group.description: Patients received one injection of 200 units (U) Dysport® at Week 0 (Day 0). The study treatment was injected into the origin of the plantar fascia in accordance with the clinical findings on palpation, the injection being distributed in four portions in a fan-shaped manner using a single 0.50 x 40mm needle. Follow-up examinations to assess the efficacy and safety of the treatment were performed at Weeks 2, 6, 10, 14 and 18.

group.title: Placebo
group.description: Patients received one injection of placebo (physiological sodium chloride solution, 2ml) at Week 0 (Day 0). The study treatment was injected into the origin of the plantar fascia in accordance with the clinical findings on palpation, the injection being distributed in four portions in a fan-shaped manner using a single 0.50 x 40mm needle. Follow-up examinations to assess the efficacy and safety of the treatment were performed at Weeks 2, 6, 10, 14 and 18.

measure.title: Number of Patients Without Pain and/or With a Pain Reduction Based on Global Assessment of Pain by Investigator at Each Visit
measure.description: A global assessment of the patient's current condition relative to baseline was performed by the Investigator at each visit using 5 level scale: significantly better, slightly better, unchanged, slightly worse, significantly worse. The number of patients for each variable at each indicated timepoint are reported.
measure.population: The ITT analysis set was defined as the set of randomized patients who received study treatment and for whom values of the efficacy parameters were available at baseline and at least one later timepoint.

analysis.groups_desc: Dysport® vs placebo at Week 2. The variables for global assessment of pain assessed by the Investigator were described at each visit as ordinal qualitative variables and were compared between the two treatment groups by means of a non parametric Wilcoxon rank sum test.

Dysport® vs placebo at Week 6. The variables for global assessment of pain assessed by the Investigator were described at each visit as ordinal qualitative variables and were compared between the two treatment groups by means of a non parametric Wilcoxon rank sum test.

Dysport® vs placebo at Week 10. The variables for global assessment of pain assessed by the Investigator were described at each visit as ordinal qualitative variables and were compared between the two treatment groups by means of a non parametric Wilcoxon rank sum test.

Dysport® vs placebo at Week 14. The variables for global assessment of pain assessed by the Investigator were described at each visit as ordinal qualitative variables and were compared between the two treatment groups by means of a non parametric Wilcoxon rank sum test.

Dysport® vs placebo at Week 18. The variables for global assessment of pain assessed by the Investigator were described at each visit as ordinal qualitative variables and were compared between the two treatment groups by means of a non parametric Wilcoxon rank sum test.

outcome.title: Number of Patients Without Pain and/or With a Pain Reduction Based on Global Assessment of Pain by Patient at Each Visit
outcome.description: A global assessment of the patient's current condition relative to baseline was performed by the patient at each visit using a 5 level scale: significantly better, slightly better, unchanged, slightly worse, significantly worse. The number of patients for each variable at each indicated timepoint are reported.
outcome.population: The ITT analysis set was defined as the set of randomized patients who received study treatment and for whom values of the efficacy parameters were available at baseline and at least one later timepoint.

measure.description: A global assessment of the patient's current condition relative to baseline was performed by the patient at each visit using a 5 level scale: significantly better, slightly better, unchanged, slightly worse, significantly worse. The number of patients for each variable at each indicated timepoint are reported.
measure.population: The ITT analysis set was defined as the set of randomized patients who received study treatment and for whom values of the efficacy parameters were available at baseline and at least one later timepoint.

analysis.groups_desc: Dysport® vs placebo at Week 2. The variables for global assessment of pain assessed by the patient were described at each visit as ordinal qualitative variables and were compared between the two treatment groups by means of a non parametric Wilcoxon rank sum test.

Dysport® vs placebo at Week 6. The variables for global assessment of pain assessed by the patient were described at each visit as ordinal qualitative variables and were compared between the two treatment groups by means of a non parametric Wilcoxon rank sum test.

Dysport® vs placebo at Week 10. The variables for global assessment of pain assessed by the patient were described at each visit as ordinal qualitative variables and were compared between the two treatment groups by means of a non parametric Wilcoxon rank sum test.

Dysport® vs placebo at Week 14. The variables for global assessment of pain assessed by the patient were described at each visit as ordinal qualitative variables and were compared between the two treatment groups by means of a non parametric Wilcoxon rank sum test.

Dysport® vs placebo at Week 18. The variables for global assessment of pain assessed by the patient were described at each visit as ordinal qualitative variables and were compared between the two treatment groups by means of a non parametric Wilcoxon rank sum test.

reported_events.desc: Adverse events are described in terms of incidence of Treatment Emergent Adverse Events. Safety was assessed on all randomized patients who received study treatment and were assessed for safety at least once after baseline.

group.title: Dysport ® 200 U
group.description: Patients received one injection of 200 units (U) Dysport® at Week 0 (Day 0). The study treatment was injected into the origin of the plantar fascia in accordance with the clinical findings on palpation, the injection being distributed in four portions in a fan-shaped manner using a single 0.50 x 40mm needle. Follow-up examinations to assess the efficacy and safety of the treatment were performed at Weeks 2, 6, 10, 14 and 18.

certain_agreements.pi_employee: Principal Investigators are NOT employed by the organization sponsoring the study.
certain_agreements.restrictive_agreement: There is NOT an agreement between Principal Investigators and the Sponsor (or its agents) that restricts the PI's rights to discuss or publish trial results after the trial is completed.
